CANDIDATE 		Karthik Mudhiraj Mandala
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location:		Manchester
QUALIFICATIONS
MSc Mechanical Engineering - University of Huddersfield 2022 Grade: Merit
Bachelor of Technology in Mechanical Engineering - Anurag University (formerly known as Anurag group of institutions), Hyderabad 2020 Grade: Distinction
Diploma in Mechanical Engineering - JN Government Polytechnic, Hyderabad 2017 Grade: Distinction
Coursework
Analysis, CAD, CFD, Design, Engineering concepts, FEA, HVAC, Production, Solid Mechanics, Structural materials, Thermal.

PERSONAL DETAILS
Location:		Manchester
QUALIFICATIONS
MSc Mechanical Engineering - University of Huddersfield 2022 Grade: Merit
Bachelor of Technology in Mechanical Engineering - Anurag University (formerly known as Anurag group of institutions), Hyderabad 2020 Grade: Distinction
Diploma in Mechanical Engineering - JN Government Polytechnic, Hyderabad 2017 Grade: Distinction
Coursework
Analysis, CAD, CFD, Design, Engineering concepts, FEA, HVAC, Production, Solid Mechanics, Structural materials, Thermal.
PROJECTS
Jul 2021 – Jan 2022 Developed new method of Airfoil Meshing.
Created unstructured airfoil mesh using ANSYS Fluent and performed 8 trails on ICEM CFD in 3 months.
Generated NACA- 12 airfoil, using Spalart-Allmaras turbulence model achieved results were 90% identical to NASA graph of NACA airfoil.
Sep 2021 – Jan 2022 Design of Single-speed reduction gearbox.
Designed two stage gear box using SolidWorks, gaining 95% performance and success rate.
Developed 2D sketches, Bill of materials, motion study, exploded view, and Bending moment of each shaft with gears.
Sep 2021 – Jan 2022 Static Analysis on overhead line equipment.
Designed FEA model using ABAQUS, attained simulation results were 97% accurate when compared to the theoretical results.
Performed Reaction force and Stress analysis on 8 models to achieve feasible interference fit to withstand given axial load using scientific principles of non-linear material behaviour.
Jan 2021 – Apr 2022 Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) of car and caravan.
Overhauled the model of car and caravan in ANSYS fluent and implemented CFD tool to investigate the complex flow fields around the model to optimize the performance.
Obtained a 10% reduction in Drag force which resulted in better Fuel efficiency by the modified design.
Jan 2020 – Mar 2020 Design and fabrication of fitness equipment for power generation.
Generated the Project idea and proposed design improvements to improve designing solutions.
Expertly created complex mechanical components using SolidWorks, enhancing system performance by 20%.
Prototyped, integrated, assembled and tested to ensure its quality and integrity.
May 2018 – Jun 2018 Internship at South Central Railway, Carriage Workshop.
Acquired knowledge regarding maintenance in workshop including AJTB machine and LHB coaches over 3 months.
Successfully attended two 2-day workshops with senior technicians and identified 5+ problematic areas.
Jan 2017 – Feb 2017 Industrial Training Program undergone at COMSAT SYSTEMS PVT LTD.
Developed Industrial strategies and approaches, addressing few inaccessibility.
Repaired identified issues, gaining an overall job success of 97% throughout.
COMMENT
Technical Skills
Microsoft Software: Excel, Word, Project Design
Software: AutoCAD and Solidworks
Analysis Software: Abaqus FEA and ANSYS
Machining Tools: CNCs, mills, lathes, grinders, arc welding
For further information please contact Julie Smith or Jan Johnston on 01695 570 696 or email julie.smith@johnston-vere.co.uk

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
